snippet: Three filmmakers set out to tell the origin story of the fantasy role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons. Two years later, there is no documentary, only broken friendships and a lawsuit.
abstract: Documentary filmmakers Anthony Savini, Andrew Pascal and James Sprattley, who set out to tell story of origin of fantasy role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons, are suing each other; documentary languished and fell apart in accusations of betrayal and backstabbing; Savini, director of Dungeons & Dragons: A Documentary, has sued his former partners for embarking on another documentary on the same subject.
lead_paragraph: Three filmmakers set out to tell the origin story of the fantasy role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons. Two years later, there is no documentary, only broken friendships and a lawsuit.

headline.main: Dungeons, Dragons & Documentaries: A Film Conjures a Battle
headline.print_headline: Dungeons, Dragons & Documentaries: A Film Conjures a Battle
